sentences.text: DEAR STOCKHOLDERS,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the Board of Directors, we are pleased to invite you to attend Occidentals  2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, which will be held at the Occidental Petroleum  Conference Center, 5 Greenway Plaza, Houston,  Texas 77046, on Friday, May 12, 2017 ,  at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the meeting begins, there will be an opportunity to meet informally with members of  Occidentals management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in the past, there will be a report on operations and an opportunity  for you to ask questions at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a significant year for Occidental, as we continued the strategic review started in 2013  and focused our organization on areas where we have sustainable competitive advantages due to  our portfolio, technology and people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the challenging commodity price environment, we  grew our production from ongoing operations, successfully executed major long-term projects and  meaningfully lowered our production costs while demonstrating our commitment to the dividend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Looking ahead, we will remain committed to disciplined capital allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While recent improvements  in oil prices are encouraging, we will stay focused on cost improvements and operating efficiencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to grow profitably and safely.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A meeting agenda and details follow, as well as voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote  promptly so that your shares will be represented and properly voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vicki Hollub President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eugene L. Batchelder Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be held at 9:00 a.m. on Friday,    May 12, 2017 , at the Occidental Petroleum Conference Center, 5 Greenway Plaza, Houston,  Texas 77046.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, stockholders will act on the following matters and consider all other matters properly  brought before the meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2: Advisory vote approving executive compensation

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 5-8: Four stockholder proposals, if properly presented at the meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on March 14, 2017 are entitled to receive notice of,  attend and to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admittance to the meeting will require an admission ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see   Admission to the Annual Meeting on page 66 for details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether you plan to attend the meeting or not, it is important that you vote by following the Internet or  telephone instructions provided in the Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of the  proxy materials or a voting instruction form, you may also vote by marking, signing and returning the proxy  or voting instruction card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will ensure that your shares are represented and  will save Occidental additional expenses of soliciting proxies.

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to strong corporate governance policies and practices and continually reviews evolving  best practices in governance and seeks input on governance matters from Occidentals stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals corporate  governance highlights, which are discussed in more detail beginning on page 16, include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Chairman of the Board  Policy prohibiting hedging of Occidentals common stock  Annual elections of the entire Board  Stockholder right to proxy access  Majority voting for directors and, in uncontested elections,  mandatory resignation if a majority vote is not received  Ability of stockholders to act by written consent  Standing Board committees comprised entirely of  independent directors  Ability of stockholders to call special meetings  Annual evaluation of the Board and its committees  No stockholder rights (poison pill) or similar plan  Director retirement age policy of 75  Demonstrated commitment to Board refreshment  Meaningful stock ownership guidelines for directors  and executive officers  Confidential Voting Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Business Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (for more detail, please see the Annual Report)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the challenging commodity price environment, Occidental significantly reduced its operating costs while increasing  Occidentals worldwide production from ongoing operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental demonstrated its commitment to the dividend as the Board increased the dividend by $0.04 per share on an annualized basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management successfully continued the  strategic review it started in 2013, and international operations are now focused on four core countries where Occidental  has decades of experience  Oman, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates in the Middle East and Colombia in Latin America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIVIDEND COMMITMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SPENDING LESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PRODUCING MORE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total spend per barrel (TSPB), an  operational efficiency metric Occidental  uses to calculate overhead, operating and capital cost per barrel of production, fell  over 30% in 2016, from $40.24 in 2015,  to $28.37 .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This represents a decrease in  TSPB of over 50% since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals production from ongoing  operations grew from 565,000 barrels  of oil equivalent (BOE) per day in 2015,  to 602,000 BOE per day in 2016, an  increase of approximately 7%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, for the fourteenth  consecutive year, Occidentals  Board of Directors increased the  dividend, returning $2.3 billion  to Occidentals stockholders in  2016.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee strived to develop a compensation program designed not only to be consistent  with industry practice, but also to attract and retain outstanding executives by providing incentives to reward them for  superior performance that supports Occidentals long-term strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 executive compensation program  is intended to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be highly aligned with stockholder interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preserve performance accountability in both strong and weak commodity price environments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Build long-term share ownership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide a consistent retention incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simplify the executive compensation program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Address the recent need to grant one-time awards, which are intended only for exceptional circumstances; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Match or exceed prevailing governance standards for performance-based compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 executive compensation program is described in detail in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section,  beginning on page 20.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of Executive Compensation Program Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program for the named executive officers includes many best-practice features that are intended to enhance the alignment of compensation with the interests of Occidentals stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do What We Dont Do Majority of named executive officer compensation  linked to performance  No automatic single-trigger vesting of equity awards  in the event of a change-in-control  Long-term incentive awards payable solely in  shares of common stock  No individual change-in-control contracts Objective TSR metric underlying the performance- based portion of the long-term incentive award  aligned with stockholder interests  No backdating or repricing of stock options Meaningful stock ownership guidelines for  executive officers  No payout of the TSR award if Occidentals TSR  ranks in the bottom quarter of the peer group Golden Parachute Policy capping golden parachute  payments in excess of 2.99 times base salary and  bonus, unless approved by stockholders  No hedging of Occidentals stock Clawback provisions in the 2015 Long-Term  Incentive Plan and the plan underlying the Annual  Cash Incentive for misconduct  No golden coffin provisions Independent Compensation Consultant Policy  requiring that the compensation consultant be  independent from management  No individual supplemental executive retirement  arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is nominating the eleven individuals  identified below for election as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless you specify  differently, proxies received will be voted FOR Spencer Abraham,  Howard I. Atkins, Eugene L. Batchelder, John E. Feick, Margaret M.  Foran, Carlos M. Gutierrez, Vicki Hollub, William R. Klesse,  Jack B. Moore, Avedick B. Poladian and Elisse B. Walter to serve  for a one-year term ending at the 2018 Annual Meeting, but in any  event, until his or her successor is elected and qualified, unless  ended earlier due to his or her death, resignation, disqualification
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or removal from office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees are currently directors  of Occidental who were elected by stockholders at the 2016  Annual Meeting, except for Mr. Moore, who was appointed to  the Board of Directors in July 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event any nominee  should be unavailable to serve at the time of the meeting, the  proxies may be voted for a substitute nominee selected by  the Board of Directors or the Board of Directors may reduce  the number of directors to eliminate the vacancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Occidentals by-laws, in an uncontested election,  directors are elected by the majority of votes cast with respect  to such director, meaning that the number of votes cast for a  director must exceed the number of votes cast against that  director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker may not vote your shares on this proposal  unless you give voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: non-votes have no effect on the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director who receives  a greater number of votes against his or her election than  votes for in an uncontested election must tender his or her  resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless accepted earlier by the Board of Directors,  such resignation will become effective on October 31st of the  year of the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: About the Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SPENCER ABRAHAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental, Health and Safety
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Abraham is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of The Abraham Group LLC, an international strategic consulting firm  based in Washington, D.C. As a Senior Analyst for Potomac Research Group, Secretary Abraham provides predictive analysis on  energy policy, energy markets and the geopolitics of energy to institutional investors in the energy space.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He represented Michigan  in the United States Senate prior to President George W. Bush selecting him as the 10th Secretary of Energy in U.S. history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During  his tenure at the Energy Department from 2001 through January 2005, he developed policies and regulations to ensure the nations  energy security, was responsible for the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve, oversaw domestic oil and gas development policy and  developed relationships with international governments, including members of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Abraham serves as a Director of PBF Energy Inc., where he serves on the Compensation and Nominating and Corporate  Governance Committees; NRG Energy, Inc., where he serves on the Compensation and Nuclear Oversight Committees; Two Harbors  Investment Corp., where he is Chairman of the Compensation Committee and a member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance  Committee; and as Chairman of the Board of Uranium Energy Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was previously a Director of GenOn Energy, Inc. and a Director  and a member of the Nominating and Governance and Compensation Committees of ICx  Technologies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves on the board of    C3 Energy, a private company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Abraham is a member of the Advisory Board of the Churchill Center, a member of the Board of  Trustees of the California Institute of Technology, and is the Chairman of the American Task Force for Lebanon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He holds a Juris Doctor  degree from Harvard Law School and is the author of Lights Out!
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: : Ten Myths About (and Real Solutions to) Americas Energy Crisis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications: Secretary Abrahams nearly two decades of experience at the highest levels of domestic and international policy and politics  shape the insights he brings to Occidentals Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a former U.S. Senator and former U.S. Secretary of Energy who directed  all aspects of the countrys energy strategy, Secretary Abraham provides the Board unique insight into public policy and energy-related  issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Secretary Abraham is a Harvard-educated attorney who, while directing the Energy Department, oversaw a budget of  nearly $24 billion (FY 2005) and was responsible for the management of senior department personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Abrahams legal training  and his government service managing complex policy, personnel and strategic issues provide Occidental with exceptional knowledge  and perspective in the areas of health, environment and safety, strategy and policy, personnel management and community relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Atkins retired as the Senior Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Wells Fargo & Company, where he was responsible  for Wells Fargos financial management functions, investment portfolios, investor relations, capital management and corporate properties  functions from 2001 to 2011 .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A 37-year veteran of the financial services industry, Mr. Atkins previously served as Executive Vice President  and Chief Financial Officer of New  Y ork Life Insurance Company, Chief Financial Officer of Midlantic Corporation and Corporate  Treasurer  of Chase Manhattan Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Atkins previously served on the Board of Directors of Ingram Micro Inc., where he served as Chairman  of the Human Resources Committee and as a member of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications: With his experience as Chief Financial Officer of Wells Fargo, one of the largest banking institutions in the United States,  Mr. Atkins brings to the Board a deep understanding of financial oversight and accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his nearly four decades in the financial  services industry, Mr. Atkins has had responsibilities in the areas of financial reporting, tax management, asset-liability management,  treasury, corporate development, investor relations and mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This experience provides the Board insight into financial  management and analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Atkins financial acumen, combined with his senior management expertise provides the Board valuable  perspective in helping to guide the fiscal management policies that further Occidentals strategic business goals.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to strong corporate  governance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board continually reviews evolving best practices in governance and seeks input  from Occidentals stockholders through Occidentals ongoing stockholder engagement program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals Corporate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Policies and Code of Business Conduct, together  with information about other governance measures adopted  by the Board of Directors and the charters of the four standing  Board committees are available at www.oxy.com/Investors/ Governance, or by writing to Occidentals Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Chairman of the Board   Policy Prohibiting hedging of Occidentals common stock   Annual elections of the entire Board   Stockholder right to proxy access     Majority voting for directors and, in uncontested elections,  mandatory resignation if a majority vote is not received     Ability of stockholders to act by written consent    Standing Board committees comprised entirely of independent  directors    Ability of stockholders to call special meetings     Annual evaluation of the Board and its committees    No stockholder rights (poison pill) or similar plan    Director retirement age policy of 75    Demonstrated commitment to Board refreshment    Meaningful stock ownership guidelines for directors and  executive officers  Confidential Voting Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors and its Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental is governed by the Board of Directors and its four standing committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure and roles of the Board and its  committees are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals by-laws provide for the Board to annually elect  one of its independent directors to be Chairman of the Board  to serve as a liaison between the Board and Occidentals  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board elected Mr. Batchelder to  serve in that position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board presides at  meetings of stockholders and the Board and has the authority  to, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assist in assuring compliance with the Corporate Governance  Policies and to recommend revisions to the policies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluate, along with the members of the Executive  Compensation Committee and the other independent directors,  the performance of the Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consult with other Board members as to recommendations on  membership and chairpersons of the Board committees and  discuss recommendations with the Corporate Governance,  Nominating and Social Responsibility Committee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Call meetings of the independent directors and chair executive  sessions of the Board at which no members of management  are present;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communicate the views of the independent directors and  the Board committees with respect to objectives set for  management by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approve the agendas for the Board and committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Propose a schedule of Board meetings and the information to  be provided by management for Board consideration;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Another key component of the Boards leadership structure is  the role of the Board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These committees regularly  report specific findings and make recommendations to the full  Board in their areas of oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommend the retention of consultants who report directly  to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards role in risk oversight recognizes the multifaceted  nature of risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a control and compliance function,  but it also involves strategic considerations in normal business  decision making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It covers legal and regulatory matters, finance,  security, cybersecurity, safety, health and environmental concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: management to review, as appropriate, compliance with existing  policies and procedures and to discuss changes or improvements  that may be required or desirable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the committees  with risk oversight responsibilities meets several times each  year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures that each committee has adequate time for  in-depth review and discussion of all matters associated with  each committees area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the committee  meetings, each committee reports to the Board, sometimes  without the Chief Executive Officer present, for discussion of  issues and findings, as well as the Boards recommendations  of appropriate changes or improvements.

sentences.text: The Board has empowered its committees with risk oversight  responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, the Governance Committee  and the Environmental, Health and Safety Committee, all  composed entirely of independent directors, are each integral  to the control and compliance aspects of risk oversight by  the Board.

sentences.text: Pursuant to Occidentals written Conflict of Interest Policy and  Code of Business Conduct, each director and executive officer  has an obligation to avoid any activity, agreement, business investment or interest, or other situation that could be construed either as divergent to or in competition with Occidentals interest or as an interference with such persons primary duty to serve Occidental, unless prior written approval has been granted by the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors.

sentences.text: Highlights of Compensation Program Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program for the named executive officers includes many best-practice features that are intended to  enhance the alignment of compensation with the interests of Occidentals stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do What We Dont Do Majority of named executive officer compensation  linked to performance  No automatic single-trigger vesting of equity awards in  the event of a change-in-control  Long-term incentive awards payable solely in shares of  common stock  No individual change-in-control contracts Objective TSR metric underlying the performance- based portion of the long-term incentive award aligned  with stockholder interests  No backdating or repricing of stock options Meaningful stock ownership guidelines for executive  officers  No payout of the TSR award if Occidentals TSR ranks  in the bottom quarter of the peer group Golden Parachute Policy capping golden parachute  payments in excess of 2.99 times base salary and  bonus, unless approved by stockholders  No hedging of Occidentals stock  Clawback provisions in the 2015 Long-Term Incentive  Plan and the plan underlying the Annual Cash Incentive  for misconduct  No golden coffin provisions Independent Compensation Consultant Policy requiring  that the compensation consultant be independent  from management  No individual supplemental executive retirement  arrangements

sentences.text: 2016 Business Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Business Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to the weak commodity price environment that continued throughout 2016, Occidental maintained its focus on achieving  operating efficiencies, cost reductions and economically growing production while maintaining an emphasis on the health and safety of  its workforce and maximizing value for its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals senior management team also continued its efforts to optimize the  companys portfolio of assets by reducing Occidentals exposure in areas that offer less attractive returns, and expanding Occidentals  footprint in the Permian Basin with acquisitions that complement Occidentals existing operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Spending Less $61.65 $40.24 $28.37 2016 2015 2014 Total Spend per Barrel 54% decrease from 2014
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management continued its focus on decreasing costs within its control and maximizing  efficiencies throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, management was challenged to  reduce its Total Spend per Barrel (TSPB) of oil equivalent sold to $28.50 in 2016,  which represented an approximate 30% decrease from the prior years TSPB of  $40.24, and a decrease of over 50% from the TSPB in 2014 of $61.65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TSPB  metric is intended to focus employees on realizing cost reductions, increasing well  productivity and optimizing base production.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, TSPB was the sole metric  underlying the performance-based portion of the Annual Cash Incentive opportunity  for the named executive officers other than Ms. Hollub, whose performance  was measured against a basket of key performance metrics, including TSPB, and    Mr. Chazen, who was not eligible for an Annual Cash Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals TSPB for 2016 was $28.37 , achieving the target TSPB set for 2016 of  $28.50 or below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Producing More 565 602 2016 2015 Production in MBOE per day 7% growth year-over-year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Occidental increased its production volumes from its ongoing operations  by 7% over the prior year while reducing its capital expenditures and meaningfully  lowering production costs year-over-year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increases in production came from  Occidentals Permian Resources business unit, the Al Hosn Gas plant in the United  Arab Emirates and Omans Block 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most production cost reductions were the  result of sustainable efficiency gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieving production growth was an operational company objective underlying a  portion of Ms. Hollub's Annual Cash Incentive opportunity for 2016, as described    beginning on page 26.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2016, Occidental announced a dividend increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current annual dividend rate is $3.04 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals senior management team views dividends as providing financial discipline, and funding the dividend is a cash flow priority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the dividend, Occidental returned $2.3 billion to stockholders in 2016.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee strived to develop a  compensation program designed not only to be consistent  with industry practice, but also to attract and retain outstanding  executives by providing incentives to reward them for superior
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance that supports Occidentals long-term strategic  objectives, whether in an up- or down-cycle commodity price  environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 executive compensation program is  intended to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be highly aligned with stockholder interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preserve performance accountability in both strong and weak commodity price environments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Build long-term share ownership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide a consistent retention incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simplify the executive compensation program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Address the recent need to grant one-time awards, which are intended only for exceptional circumstances; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Match or exceed prevailing governance standards for performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Considerations and Actions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Considerations and Actions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In modifying the executive compensation program for the named executive officers in 2016 to meet the Compensation Committees  objectives for the program, as discussed above, the Compensation Committee focused on the following key considerations and  took responsive actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the current dynamic commodity price environment, the Compensation Committee continues to evaluate  the optimal weightings and metrics underlying the long-term incentive program and the plan underlying the Annual Cash Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The absolute financial targets underlying the majority of  the 2015 long-term incentive program and the Annual Cash  Incentive award not accommodating a sharp and sustained  decline in commodity prices, which have a substantial impact  on Occidentals financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focus the long-term incentive program on relative  Total Shareholder Return (TSR), rather than absolute  financial targets, which incentivizes superior performance  throughout the commodity price cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An emphasis on  TSR preserves performance accountability in both strong  and weak commodity price environments, and is aligned  with stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2015 executive compensation program, a significant  majority of Occidentals long-term incentive awards and  the Annual Cash Incentive award were based on achieving  absolute financial goals, which were largely dependent on  the prices Occidental receives for its products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meaningful  targets with respect to these goals proved difficult to set  in a volatile commodity price environment, as results were  largely a reflection of commodity price movements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retained a modifier on  the TSR award that limits payout of the award to target if  Occidentals absolute TSR is negative over the performance  period to align pay with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The inclusion of a time-vesting restricted stock unit award  in the long-term incentive program is intended, in part, to  provide predictability to the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The two-year holding  period aligns the interests of the named executive officers  with Occidentals long-term stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recent use of off-cycle, special awards to recognize  performance and maintain an alignment of Occidentals  pay to its performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, the Compensation Committee awarded  supplemental long-term incentive awards to recognize  operational excellence, incentivize retention, and to address  the consequence of the collapse in commodity prices on  outstanding long-term incentive awards, which had the  effect of negating the value of many of the long-term  incentive awards for reasons outside of managements  control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of the target long-term incentive award  opportunity remains subject to performance-based vesting  criteria (70% for Ms. Hollub and 55% for the other named  executive officers).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals CEO transition and the desire for a conventional,  performance-based compensation strategy for its new CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee felt that it was appropriate  for Ms. Hollub to be eligible for an Annual Cash Incentive  award with the significant majority of the target value  (80%) tied to company performance, with the remainder  tied to an assessment of individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chazen was not eligible for an Annual Cash Incentive  or Total Shareholder Return award in 2014, 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These recent compensation arrangements were the result  of an agreement between Mr. Chazen and the Board and  were unique to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hollub also participates in the long-term incentive  program, and 70% of her target long-term incentive award  is tied to creating value for the companys stockholders  through a TSR award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the 2016 program matched or exceeded prevailing governance standards for performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring of compensation surveys, peer group data and  other materials regarding executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee regularly reviews compensation surveys, peer group data and other general and executive compensation materials shared or prepared by the Compensation Committees independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee does not benchmark  pay for the executive officers to any specific level relative  to peers, the Compensation Committee found that overall  pay magnitude for the named executive officers was  reasonable.

sentences.text: In performing these duties, the Compensation  Committee obtains input, advice and information from senior  management, members of Occidentals Human Resources  team and an independent compensation consultant, as further  described below, throughout the year.

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee also considers the views expressed by Occidentals  investors and stockholder advisory groups in making executive  compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses  publicly available data regarding the executive compensation  practices of its peer group (defined below) as an additional tool,  but does not benchmark executive compensation to a specific  percentile within the peer group.

sentences.text: In 2016, the  Compensation Committee engaged Meridian Compensation  Partners, LLC (Meridian) as its compensation consultant to  provide advice on various executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed the independence  of Meridian under the Securities and Exchange Commission  rules, the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) Listed Company  Manual standards, and Occidentals Independent Compensation  Consultant Policy and found Meridian to be independent and  without conflicts of interest.

sentences.text: Risk Assessment of Compensation Policies and Practices

sentences.text: Although the majority of the executive compensation program  pay is performance-based, the Compensation Committee  believes the program does not encourage unnecessary or  excessive risk-taking.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative nature of the TSR performance measure, which  minimizes the impact that volatile commodity prices have on  Occidentals TSR award;

sentences.text: Forfeiture and recoupment provisions for awards in the event  of violations of Occidentals Code of Business Conduct;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of long-term incentive awards that are 100% in stock  rather than cash; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualified Defined Contribution Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental does not have a defined benefit pension plan that  provides named executive officers a fixed monthly retirement  payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, all salaried employees on the U.S. dollar  payroll, including the named executive officers, are eligible to  participate in one or more tax-qualified, defined contribution plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The defined contribution retirement plan  (Retirement Plan) is funded annually through a reallocation  process from the employees Supplemental Retirement Plan II  (SRP II) account balance (described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because it is not  possible to determine the exact amount that could be contributed  to the Retirement Plan without exceeding governmental limits  until the end of the year, the reallocation process has been  developed to maximize the amount contributed each year to  a tax-qualified defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan  is company-funded, and employees may not contribute to the  Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officers are fully vested in  their account balances under the Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts  allocated to the Retirement Plan are included in the SRP II  contributions by Occidental in the  All Other Compensation  column of the Summary Compensation Table on page 37 .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the defined contribution 401(k) savings plan (Savings Plan) permitted employees to save a percentage of their annual salary up to the $265,000 limit set by IRS regulations, and employee pre-tax contributions were limited to $18,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may direct their contributions to a variety of investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental  matches two dollars for every one dollar the employee contributes  up to 2% of eligible pay, plus an additional dollar-for-dollar match on the next 3% of eligible pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officers are fully vested in their account balances under the Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts contributed by Occidental to the Savings Plan are included in the  All Other Compensation column of the Summary Compensation Table on page 37 .

sentences.text: Employees whose participation in Occidentals tax-qualified  defined contribution plans is limited by applicable tax laws are  eligible to participate in Occidentals Supplemental Retirement  Plan II (SRP II), which provides additional retirement benefits  outside of those limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of August 2016, interest on SRP II accounts is allocated daily  to each participants account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of interest earnings  is calculated using a rate equal to the five-year U.S. Treasury  Note rate on the last business day of the processing month  plus 2%, converted to a monthly allocation factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual plan allocations for each participant restore the amounts that would have accrued for salary and Annual Cash Incentive under the qualified plans, but for the tax law limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Account balances are fully vested after three years of service and are payable following separation from service, or upon attainment of a specified age elected by the participant, as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to provide greater financial planning flexibility to  participants while not increasing costs under the plan, the  SRP II allows in-service distribution of a participants account  at a specified age, but not earlier than age 60, as elected by the  participant when initially participating in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Modified Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Modified Deferred Compensation Plan (MDCP), the maximum amount of an executive officers salary or Annual Cash  Incentive that may be deferred for any one year is limited to  $75,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants overall plan balance must be less than $1 million at the end of any given year to enable a participant to defer compensation for the subsequent year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred amounts earn interest at a rate equal to the five-year U.S. Treasury Note rate plus 2%, except for amounts deferred prior to 1994, which continue to earn interest at a minimum interest rate of 8%.

sentences.text: Payments and other benefits provided to named executive  officers in various termination circumstances or in connection  with a change in control are subject to certain policies, plans and  agreements.

sentences.text: Notice and Severance Pay Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Occidentals Notice  and Severance Pay Plan, employees terminated in certain  circumstances without cause or as a result of a change in  control are eligible for up to 12 months base salary depending  on years of service, two months of contributions pursuant to  the Savings Plan and the SRP II, and continued medical and  dental coverage for the 12-month notice and severance period  at the active employee rate.

sentences.text: Occidentals Golden Parachute Policy  provides that, subject to certain exceptions, Occidental will not  grant Golden Parachute Benefits (as defined in the Policy) to any  senior executive that exceed 2.99 times his or her salary plus  Annual Cash Incentive pay, unless the grant of such benefits  is approved by a vote of the corporations stockholders.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive a combination of cash, in the form of an annual retainer payable on a monthly basis (and as  further described below), and stock-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental employees receive no additional pay for serving as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with its charter, the Corporate Governance Committee annually reviews director compensation and makes  recommendations regarding director compensation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table describes the components of the 2016 non-employee director compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Element 2016 Director Compensation Program Annual Cash Retainer $125,000 for non-employee directors $155,000 for Chairman of the Board Annual Equity Award(1) $225,000 for non-employee directors $335,000 for Chairman of the Board Board or Committee Meeting Fees None Committee Chair Additional Annual Equity Award(1) $25,000 for each committee chaired
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Award consists of shares of common stock (or deferred stock units, if the director elected to receive units).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Equity Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that director and stockholder interests should be aligned over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As  a result, the majority of the annual compensation provided to the non-employee directors is in the form of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the grant date, directors have the option to elect to receive their equity awards as common stock or as deferred common stock units (deferred stock units).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provided, however, that all deferred stock units are payable  upon the occurrence of certain change in control events or the  directors separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Occidentals Stock  Ownership Guidelines, non-employee directors are required to  own a number of shares of common stock of Occidental having  a value of not less than six times the annual cash retainer for  non-employee directors within five years of election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 28, 2017 , each of our non-employee directors is  in compliance with these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common Stock Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of this award, a  director will receive a fully vested number of shares of common  stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, 50% of the shares may not be sold or transferred  for three years from the grant date and the other 50% may not  be sold or transferred until the director ceases to serve on the  Board for any reason; provided, however, that all of the shares  become transferable in the event of certain change in control  events or the directors separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matching Gift Program and Other Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors  are eligible to participate in the Occidental Petroleum Corporation  Matching Gift Program, which matches contributions made  by employees and directors to educational institutions and  organizations, as well as arts and cultural organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  limit for such matching contributions was $50,000 in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Occidental reimburses non-employee directors  for expenses related to service on the Board, including hotel,  airfare, ground transportation and meals for themselves and their  guest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental does not provide option awards, non-equity  incentive awards or retirement plans for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Stock Unit Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the  award, a director will receive a certain number of stock units,  with each unit equivalent to one share, which become payable in  the form of common shares upon the satisfaction of the deferral  period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the deferred stock units are payable upon the  third anniversary of the grant date and the remaining 50% are  payable on the date of the directors separation from service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLIMATE CHANGE ASSESSMENT REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: which will likely affect the demand for carbon-based fuels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notably, the two largest global emitters  the United States  and China  agreed in 2014 to policy and regulatory actions  to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and expanded those  commitments in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: Shareholders request that Occidental Petroleum  Corporation (Occidental), with board oversight, produce an  assessment of long-term portfolio impacts of plausible scenarios  that address climate change, at reasonable cost and omitting  proprietary information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment, produced annually  with the initial report issued prior to the 2018 Annual Meeting of  Stockholders, should explain how capital planning and business  strategies incorporate analyses of the short- and long-term  financial risks of a lower carbon economy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the report  should outline the impacts of multiple, fluctuating demand and  price scenarios on the company's existing reserves and resource  portfolio  including the International Energy Agency's 450  Scenario,  which sets out an energy pathway consistent with  the internationally recognized goal of limiting the global increase  in temperature to 2 degrees Celsius.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental recognizes in its Securities and Exchange Commission  filings that actions that place a price on carbon can have a  significant impact on its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the increased likelihood  of public policy action and viable technological advancements  to address climate change, investors require analyses regarding  the potential impact on Occidental's resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders  are therefore requesting information to help assess Occidental's  long-term resilience and how it expects to perform under a  range of carbon scenarios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately forty-nine percent  of shares voted supported this resolution in 2016*.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental's competitors are providing additional disclosure:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUPPORTING STATEMENT:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ten oil and gas companies announced a shared ambition to  limit the global average temperature rise to 2 degrees Celsius  (Oil and Gas Climate Initiative);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term Occidental investors expect the company to generate  continued shareholder value as energy policies evolve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Climate  change, and actions to mitigate and adapt to it, will meaningfully  affect the demand for, and costs associated with, locating and  extracting carbon-based fuels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shell, BP , and Statoil endorsed the "Strategic Resilience for  2035 and Beyond" shareholder resolutions, which received  almost unanimous support in 2015; Suncor endorsed a similar  resolution with overwhelming support in 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The likelihood of widespread implementation of public policies  related to climate change significantly increased in 2016,  concurrent with the Paris Agreement reached at the 21st session  of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change  Conference of the Parties (COP21).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Paris Agreement,  countries agreed to take action to keep the increase in global  temperature to "well below" 2 degrees Celsius, and to pursue  efforts to limit it to 1.5 degrees Celsius.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, governments  and companies are pursuing mitigation strategies including  increasing energy efficiency and sourcing renewable energy,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ConocoPhillips and Total test capital planning decisions against  multiple carbon-constrained scenarios and disclose the results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Publication of the requested report will demonstrate to  shareholders that Occidental is strategically planning to remain  competitive in a carbon-constrained future and generate continued  value for shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *excluding abstentions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5: CLIMATE CHANGE ASSESSMENT REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Statement in Opposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental recognizes the importance of economic and policy  assessments taking place in many countries and among  international organizations related to climate change, including  the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change  Paris Agreement to set a goal of limiting global warming to  less than 2 degrees Celsius compared to pre-industrial levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: are robust at lower price levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capital allocation is based on  expected commodity prices, and specific financial targets or  strategic objectives must be met to approve a project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, Occidentals business strategies incorporate risks of a lower carbon economy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key strategy is to focus on mature hydrocarbon basins that have existing infrastructure that enable us bring reserves to production near-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This shorter-cycle delivery approach is lower risk and drives operational efficiencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of our operations have the shorter time horizons common to the E&P sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: So, for Occidental, scenario planning is largely an exercise measured in years, not decades.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, Occidental is well situated to shift capital allocation in the face of changing climate-related risks and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we continue to enhance our disclosures to address climate- related risks and opportunities, we are guided by the four  elements of the Financial Stability Boards Recommendations  of the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  are currently expanding our disclosure of how climate-related  issues are relevant in our current governance, strategy and  risk management practices, which practices are described  further below, and evaluating enhancements to our scenario  planning process to explicitly incorporate climate-related risks  and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Occidentals industry-leading projects to profit from  carbon capture and storage (CCS) and use of carbon dioxide  (CO2) for enhanced oil recovery (EOR) puts us in a position to  do well in  and not just survive  a carbon constrained future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidental is the largest injector of CO2 for EOR in the Permian  Basin, and a leader globally in CCS technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Climate-related oversight is integral to our Board and  management structure and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occidentals board has  an Environmental, Health and Safety Committee, which reviews  and discusses with management the status of environmental,  health and safety issues, including climate-related matters,  and monitors Occidentals compliance with applicable laws  and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017 , the Board added to the  Environmental Committees charter the responsibility to  regularly review climate-related risks and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board also has a Corporate Governance, Nominating and  Social Responsibility Committee, which reviews Occidentals  policies, programs and practices on social responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At  the operational level, climate-related issues are factored into  business strategy through a multi-disciplinary committee of  managers, several of whom meet directly with these Board  Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board committee and management structure  demonstrates the importance of these issues to Occidentals  business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CCS technologies have been recognized by the Intergovernmental  Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) as essential in the mix of  climate mitigation technologies needed to limit the global  increase in temperature to 2 degrees Celsius.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are the  only company that has achieved EPA-approval of first-of-its- kind plans for simultaneous CO2 injection and sequestration  for EOR production operations, an important milestone in the  development and commercialization of CCS technology as  an approach for long-term management of greenhouse gas  emissions.

sentences.text: Nominating Committee Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the policy of the Corporate Governance, Nominating and Social Responsibility Committee (Nominating Committee) to consider nominees to the Board of Directors recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Nominating Committee Policy, which is available at www.oxy.com/Investors, stockholder recommendations must be received by the Corporate Secretary of Occidental between September 1 and November 30 of the year preceding the annual meeting to be considered by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each recommendation must include the following information:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if a vacancy on the Board were to occur, it would use these  sources as well as stockholder recommendations to identify  candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding if a candidate recommended by a stockholder or  identified by another source is qualified to be a nominee, it is  the Nominating Committees policy to consider:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the candidate is independent as defined in Occidentals  Corporate Governance Policies and as applied with respect to  Occidental and the stockholder recommending the nominee,  if applicable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. As to each person whom the stockholder proposes for election or re-election as a director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the candidate has the business experience, character,  judgment, acumen and time to commit in order to make an   ongoing positive contribution to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The name, age, business address and residence address of the person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the candidate would contribute to the Board achieving  a diverse and broadly inclusive membership, including  consideration of the diversity characteristics set forth in  Occidentals Corporate Governance Policies further described  at www.oxy.com/Investors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal occupation or employment of the person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The class or series and number of shares of capital stock of Occidental which are owned beneficially or of record by the person; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other information relating to the person that is required to be disclosed in solicitations for proxies for election of directors pursuant to the Rules and Regulations of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the candidate has the specialized knowledge or  expertise, such as financial or audit experience, necessary  to satisfy membership requirements for committees where  specialized knowledge or expertise may be desirable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As to the stockholder making the recommendation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is a vacancy and the Nominating Committee believes  that a recommended candidate has good potential for Board  service, the Nominating Committee will arrange an interview  with the candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Nominating  Committee will not recommend any candidate to the Board  who has not been interviewed by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The name and address of record of such stockholder; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The class or series and number of shares of capital stock of Occidental which are beneficially owned by the stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholders recommendation must include the  recommended persons written consent to being named as a nominee and to serving as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with its charter, the Nominating Committee annually  reviews its performance and reports its findings to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also assists the Board in performing  its self-evaluation, which includes an assessment of whether  the Board has the necessary diversity of skills, backgrounds and  experiences to meet Occidentals ongoing needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In prior years, the Nominating Committee has identified candidates  through recommendations from non-employee directors,  executive officers, including the Chief Executive Officer, and  other third parties.
